content: your sock won t be the best fit if it s off-target by 3/8 or more i definitely recommend ripping back to checkpoint 2 and re-adjusting your row count accordingly † if your fabric is smaller than 2 inches or larger than 2 1/4 inches at checkpoint 1 i highly recommend you check your stitch gauge if it does not match 8 st/inch your sock will not fit and no adjustments can be done at this point to alter this fate charts stage 1 toe increases heel shaping toe increases heel needle 1 heel needle 2 stage 2 heel body no toe shaping heel needle 1 heel needle 2 stage 3 toe decreases instep shaping toe decreases instep needles 1 and 2 stage 4 short row instep and leg shaping needle 1 variations garter stitch variation this is an easy variation on the basic instructions for people who want a fabric that s more elastic or who just wish to avoid purling in this variation you simply knit on all ws row instead of purl do the cast on as described in main instructions then row 1 turn to purl side and work a knit shaping row as described in main instructions row 2 turn and work the next row as plain knit repeat row 1-2 for the remainder of the pattern left stockinette right garter stitch note with this variation it can be a bit tricky distinguishing rs from ws especially in the first few row since the fabric looks the same on both sides disregard the checkpoints at the end of each stage because your garter fabric will be noticeably narrower than stockinette work 12 row in stage 1 and proceed to stage 2 in stage 2 find your target number of row in the width chart then work 2 more row before proceeding to stage 3 in stage 3 work 12 row proceed to stage 4 then graft when it comes time to graft the sides together this knitty article contains instructions on grafting garter stitch to make a sock in garter that twists the opposite direction all you have to do is turn it inside-out ribbed leg variation this variation uses regular stockinette on the foot and banded stockinette a few row of knit followed by a few row of purl on the leg if you like your socks to have a nice snug cuff above the ankle this is a good one for you row 1-2 work as for main instructions row 3 rs purl instead of knit between cuff and i-marker on needle 1 and between d- marker and cuff on needle 2 note you will have to work any leg shaping with purls instead of knits refer to the section knitting the mate of the knitty pattern for details row 4 ws knit sts between cuff and adjacent marker i-marker on needle 1 d-marker on needle 2 work the rest of the pattern as specified in
